text.39:
Allah selanjutnya menjelaskan bahwa segala macam nikmat itu adalah anugerah yang diberikan-Nya kepada Sulaiman secara khusus. Nikmat itu meliputi kerajaan yang besar, kekayaan yang berlimpah dan kekuasaan yang tak pernah diberikan kepada yang lain. Nikmat-nikmat itu dianugerahkan kepadanya agar digunakan sebagaimana mestinya.

Allah menandaskan bahwa nikmat-nikmat itu diberikan kepada Sulaiman tanpa pertanggungjawaban, karena Sulaiman telah diberi kemampuan untuk mengendalikan segala macam nikmat itu.
text.40: Kemudian Allah menjelaskan bahwa di samping kemuliaan yang telah dicapainya di dunia, yang sangat menakjubkan itu, ia akan dilimpahi karunia yang lebih nikmat lagi dan kedudukannya yang lebih mulia. Allah menjanjikan kepadanya bahwa ia akan dimasukkan dalam deretan hamba-hamba-Nya yang mempunyai kedudukan yang sangat dekat kepada Allah, yaitu kedudukan yang diperoleh para rasul dan nabi, tempat kembali yang baik yaitu surga Na'im yang penuh dengan segala macam kenikmatan.
text.41:
Allah memerintahkan kepada Rasulullah saw agar menceritakan kepada kaumnya kisah Ayub yang sangat sabar menghadapi cobaan hidup dan taat kepada Allah. Pada saat menghadapi cobaan yang sangat berat itu, ia berdoa kepada Allah dan mengadukan agar penderitaannya itu dihilangkan.

Beberapa ahli tafsir menyebutkan bahwa Ayub adalah seorang nabi yang sangat kaya. Ia adalah seorang petani dan pemelihara ternak. Di samping itu, juga sebagai pemimpin kaumnya di sebuah negeri yang terletak di sebelah tenggara Laut Mati. Negerinya terletak di antara kota Adum dan padang pasir Arab, sangat subur, dialiri oleh mata air yang sangat banyak. Ia hidup di antara zaman Nabi Ibrahim dan Nabi Musa. Semula beliau hidup makmur dan bahagia, amat taat beragama, dan banyak sanak keluarganya. Ia sangat senang atas hasil usaha yang dicapainya, juga atas kekayaan, keluarga, dan kesehatannya. Allah lalu ingin menguji ketabahannya dengan menimpakan penyakit kulit yang sangat parah. Begitu berat penyakitnya dan begitu lama dideritanya hingga harta bendanya habis, dan keluarganya bertebaran ke negeri-negeri sekitarnya untuk mencari penghidupan. Di tengah-tengah penderitaannya itu, ia merasa sangat lelah dan menderita. Ia merasa ada setan yang mengusik jiwanya ketika beribadah kepada Allah. Lalu ia mengadukan kepada Allah agar diberi petunjuk untuk melepaskan dirinya dari penderitaan dan siksaan yang dialaminya.

Allah berfirman:

Dan (ingatlah kisah) Ayub, ketika dia berdoa kepada Tuhannya, "(Ya Tuhanku), sungguh, aku telah ditimpa penyakit, padahal Engkau Tuhan Yang Maha Penyayang dari semua yang penyayang." (al-Anbiya'/21: 83)
text.42:
Ayat ini menjelaskan bahwa karena ketaatan dan kesabaran Ayub menghadapi cobaan, Allah mengabulkan doanya dengan memerintahkan kepadanya agar menghentakkan kakinya ke bumi. Kemudian dari bumi itu memancar mata air yang sejuk. Lalu Ayub diperintahkan agar mandi dan minum dengan air itu. Seketika itu, Allah menyembuhkan penyakitnya seakan-akan tidak pernah sakit sebelumnya.

Kemudian ia menghimpun kembali keluarganya yang telah terpencar, dan mereka akhirnya dapat menyebarkan keturunan yang banyak, sebagai rahmat Allah kepadanya dan kepada keturunannya.

Pada akhir ayat, Allah menegaskan bahwa ketaatan dan kesabaran Ayub itu merupakan pelajaran bagi orang-orang yang berakal dan menjadi petunjuk bagi seluruh manusia bahwa rahmat Allah itu dekat sekali pada orang-orang yang senantiasa melakukan perbuatan yang baik. Hal ini juga menjadi contoh bahwa setiap perjuangan itu meskipun pada mulanya terasa sangat melelahkan, tetapi bila dilakukan dengan penuh ketabahan, niscaya segala kesulitan pasti dapat diatasi, dan kemenangan pasti dapat diraih. Pengalaman berharga yang dapat dipetik dari kisah Ayub ini ialah bahwa orang tidak boleh berputus asa untuk mencari jalan ke luar dalam menghadapi rintangan, hingga ia mendapatkan jalan untuk mengatasi rintangan itu, dengan memohon petunjuk kepada Allah agar diberi limpahan hidayah-Nya.

text.44:
Kemudian Allah mengisahkan keringanan hukuman bagi istrinya yang diberikan kepada Ayub. Allah memerintahkan agar Ayub mengambil seberkas rumput untuk dipukulkan kepada istrinya. Pukulan rumput ini cukup sebagai pengganti dari sumpah yang pernah ia ucapkan. Dalam ayat-ayat Al-Qur'an tidak disebutkan apa sebab ia bersumpah dan apa sumpahnya. Hanya hadis sajalah yang menyebutkan bahwa ia bersumpah karena istrinya, yang bernama Rahmah putri Ifraim, pergi untuk sesuatu keperluan dan terlambat datang. Ayub bersumpah akan memukulnya 100 kali apabila ia sembuh. Dengan pukulan seikat rumput itu, ia dianggap telah melaksanakan sumpahnya, sebagai kemurahan bagi Ayub sendiri dan bagi istrinya yang telah melayaninya dengan baik pada saat sakit. Dengan adanya kemurahan Allah itu, Ayub pun terhindar dari melanggar sumpah.

Di akhir ayat, Allah memuji bahwa Ayub adalah hamba-Nya yang sabar, baik, dan taat. Sabar menghadapi cobaan yang diberikan kepadanya, baik cobaan yang menimpa dirinya, hartanya, serta keluarganya. Dia dimasukkan dalam golongan hamba-Nya yang baik perangainya karena tidak mudah berputus asa, dan menumpahkan harapannya kepada Allah. Dia juga sebagai hamba-Nya yang taat, karena kegigihannya memperjuangkan perintah-perintah agama serta memelihara diri, keluarga, dan kaumnya dari kehancuran.

Mengenai ketaatan Ayub dapat diketahui dari sebuah riwayat bahwa apabila ia menemui cobaan mengatakan:

"Ya Allah, Engkaulah yang mengambil dan Engkau pula yang memberi."

Pada waktu bermujanat ia pun berkata:

"Ya Tuhanku, "Engkau telah mengetahui betul bahwa lisanku tidak akan berbeda dengan hatiku, hatiku tidak mengikuti penglihatan, hamba sahaya yang kumiliki tidak akan mempermainkan aku, aku tidak makan terkecuali bersama-sama anak yatim dan aku tidak berada dalam keadaan kenyang dan berpakaian sedang di sampingku ada orang yang lapar atau telanjang."
text.45:
Allah memerintahkan kepada Rasul-Nya agar mengisahkan kepada kaumnya perjuangan Nabi Ibrahim, dan putra beliau Ishak yang juga diangkat menjadi nabi, serta cucunya Yakub yang mencapai derajat kenabian juga.

Mereka itu hamba-hamba Allah yang terkenal ketabahannya dan mencapai kemuliaan karena ketaatannya kepada Allah. Karena perjuangannya yang gigih dalam menegakkan kebenaran dan menghancurkan kebatilan, mereka ini dilimpahi kekuatan oleh Allah untuk memiliki ilmu pengetahuan agama yang luas dan kekuatan untuk memimpin kaumnya ke jalan yang terang, jauh dari kesesatan. Mereka juga diberi kemampuan untuk melaksanakan amal perbuatan yang diridai Allah, yang bermanfaat bagi kepentingan hidup kaumnya di dunia dan kebahagiaan mereka di akhirat.

Pada ayat ini terdapat sindiran bagi kaum musyrikin bahwa apabila mereka tidak mau mengambil pelajaran dari kisah tersebut tentulah mereka akan tetap berada dalam kesesatan dan di akhirat nanti mereka akan mengalami penderitaan yang sangat mengerikan.
text.46:
Pada ayat ini, Allah menjelaskan sebab-sebab para nabi tersebut mencapai kemuliaan baik dunia maupun akhirat adalah karena memelihara kebersihan jiwa dan menjauhkan diri dari dosa yang tercela. Karena jiwa mereka bersih dari noda-noda kemusyrikan, maka mereka ikhlas menaati perintah-perintah Allah. Juga karena mereka selalu menjauhi perbuatan-perbuatan tercela, maka mereka gigih dalam memperjuangkan kebenaran dan melenyapkan kebatilan. Dengan demikian, tergambarlah dalam jiwa mereka akhlak yang tinggi, dan sifat yang mulia yang menyebabkan mereka patut diteladani. 

Seluruh kegiatan mereka baik berupa tenaga, harta, maupun pikiran, semata-mata dipergunakan untuk peribadatan secara murni, dengan tujuan ingin mendapat rida Allah dan menjunjung tinggi kalimat tauhid. Dengan landasan itu, mereka selalu memperingatkan kaumnya pada kehidupan akhirat yang kekal. Kenikmatan di dunia yang hanya sementara itu hendaknya dijadikan sarana untuk berbakti pada Allah, sehingga dengan demikian mereka di akhirat memperoleh kenikmatan yang tiada putus-putusnya, yang disediakan bagi hamba-hamba yang mendapatkan keridaan-Nya. Sedang hamba-hamba yang ingkar dan selalu bergelimang dalam kesesatan hidup, akan merasakan azab yang sangat pedih.
text.47:
Pada ayat ini, Allah menegaskan bahwa para hamba pilihan-Nya, yaitu Ibrahim, Ishak, dan Yakub, benar-benar mempunyai jiwa yang bersih. Tidak tersirat sedikit pun dalam jiwa mereka sifat-sifat yang tercela, seperti sifat dengki dan takabur, melainkan terpancar dari dalam diri mereka sifat-sifat yang terpuji yang menjadi teladan dan contoh yang baik bagi kaumnya.

Pelajaran yang dapat diambil dari ayat ini ialah, jiwa yang bersih dan akal yang sehat merupakan syarat yang harus dipenuhi oleh orang yang menginginkan kemuliaan baik dunia maupun akhirat. Orang yang jiwanya bersih dan akalnya sehat tentu melihat tanda-tanda kebesaran Allah yang ada pada dirinya dan ada di langit dan bumi seisinya. Sedang orang yang jiwanya kotor dan pikirannya terbelenggu oleh kebendaan, tentu tidak akan melihat tanda-tanda kebesaran Allah dan tidak akan melihat kebenaran wahyu yang dibawa oleh rasul.
text.48:
Pada ayat ini, Allah memerintahkan kepada Rasulullah saw agar mengisahkan nabi-nabi yang lain, yaitu Ismail, Ilyasa', dan Zulkifli kepada kaumnya. Mereka ini adalah nabi-nabi yang gigih memperjuangkan tegaknya agama Allah di tengah-tengah kaumnya.

Ayat ini memisahkan penyebutan Ismail dengan ayahnya Ibrahim. Hal ini mengisyaratkan adanya perpisahan antara keduanya. Memang Nabi Ismail berpisah dengan ayahnya, setelah beliau ditinggal bersama ibunya, Hajar, di Mekah. thahir bin 'Asyur, seperti yang dikutip Quraish Shihab, memahami bahwa pemisahan itu karena Nabi Ismail kelak akan menjadi kakek moyang dari umat yang besar, yaitu bangsa Arab. Sedang Ishak dan Yakub disatukan dengan Ibrahim karena mereka memang menjadi kakek moyang Bani Israil.

Penggabungan Ilyasa' dan Ismail karena adanya persamaan antara keduanya, antara lain mereka sama-sama sebagai manusia pilihan, kedudukan Ilyasa' di kalangan Bani Israil serupa dengan kedudukan Ismail di kalangan keturunan Ibrahim. Kesamaan itu adalah Ilyasa' membantu Nabi Ilyas, sebagaimana Ismail membantu Ibrahim.

Menurut asy-Syaukani dalam Tafsir Fath al-Qadir disebutkan bahwa penggabungan penyebutan Zulkifli, Ilyasa', dan Ismail karena mereka mempunyai kesamaan, yaitu orang-orang penyabar.

Pada penghujung ayat, Allah menegaskan bahwa mereka ini adalah hamba-hamba Allah yang paling baik, berakhlak tinggi, berbudi luhur, dan membimbing kaumnya agar taat kepada Allah dan menjauhi kemusyrikan.
text.49: Allah menjelaskan bahwa ayat-ayat yang menceritakan kemuliaan para nabi dan kebahagiaan mereka di akhirat adalah kehormatan bagi mereka untuk selalu diingat oleh manusia. Di samping memperoleh kemuliaan di dunia, mereka pun disediakan tempat kembali yang baik di akhirat. Pada ayat ini, para nabi dimasukkan ke dalam kelompok orang-orang yang takwa, agar orang-orang yang memperhatikan seruan Rasulullah pada saat mendengar firman Allah ini menjadi sadar bahwa apabila mereka mau mencontoh dan meneladani perjuangan para rasul itu, tentu mereka juga akan memperoleh kehormatan di dunia dan kebaikan di akhirat. Demikian pula orang-orang yang mau melaksanakan perintah Allah serta menjauhi larangan-Nya, tentu akan memperoleh nasib yang sama.
text.50:
Pada ayat-ayat ini Allah menjelaskan betapa nikmatnya tempat kembali yang disediakan kepada para rasul dan orang-orang yang bertakwa itu. Pintu surga 'Adn selalu terbuka, dan keadaannya selalu menyenangkan, sebagai tanda bahwa segalanya telah dipersiapkan untuk menghormati hamba-hamba pilihan Allah yang akan menghuninya. Kamar-kamarnya luas yang mengagumkan, pelayan-pelayannya yang indah dipandang mata, dan suasana lingkungannya yang mencengangkan. Semuanya dalam tata ciptaan yang memesonakan, yang belum pernah terlihat sebelumnya, belum pernah terngiang di telinga dan belum pernah terlintas dalam hati.

Di dalam surga itu keinginan mereka terpenuhi, dipan-dipan tempat mereka membaringkan diri, tersedia serba memuaskan, buah-buahan yang beraneka ragam, jenis rasa dan aromanya, serta minuman dengan segala macamnya, siap disuguhkan.

Sebenarnya kenikmatan yang terdapat dalam surga itu adalah puncak dari segala kenikmatan. Kenikmatan yang ada di surga itu diungkapkan dengan buah-buahan dan minuman sebagai kenikmatan yang sesuai dengan keadaan masyarakat Mekah pada waktu itu.

Kalau disebutkan buah-buahan yang beraneka ragam dan minuman yang bermacam jenisnya, sudah barang tentu selera mereka terangsang, dan timbullah keinginan mereka untuk menikmati. Di samping itu, mereka didampingi oleh bidadari-bidadari yang sangat sopan. Masing-masing penghuni surga dilayani oleh perempuan-perempuan surga yang khusus untuknya, dan tidak memberikan pelayanannya kepada penghuni surga yang lain. Semua perempuan surga sama-sama cantiknya dan semuanya remaja.

Kamar-kamarnya luas yang mengagumkan, pelayan-pelayannya yang indah dipandang mata, dan suasana lingkungannya yang mencengangkan. Semuanya dalam tata ciptaan yang memesonakan, yang belum pernah terlihat sebelumnya, belum pernah terngiang di telinga dan belum pernah terlintas dalam hati.

Di dalam surga itu keinginan mereka terpenuhi, dipan-dipan tempat mereka membaringkan diri, tersedia serba memuaskan, buah-buahan yang beraneka ragam, jenis rasa dan aromanya, serta minuman dengan segala macamnya, siap disuguhkan.

Sebenarnya kenikmatan yang terdapat dalam surga itu adalah puncak dari segala kenikmatan. Kenikmatan yang ada di surga itu diungkapkan dengan buah-buahan dan minuman sebagai kenikmatan yang sesuai dengan keadaan masyarakat Mekah pada waktu itu.

Kalau disebutkan buah-buahan yang beraneka ragam dan minuman yang bermacam jenisnya, sudah barang tentu selera mereka terangsang, dan timbullah keinginan mereka untuk menikmati. Di samping itu, mereka didampingi oleh bidadari-bidadari yang sangat sopan. Masing-masing penghuni surga dilayani oleh perempuan-perempuan surga yang khusus untuknya, dan tidak memberikan pelayanannya kepada penghuni surga yang lain. Semua perempuan surga sama-sama cantiknya dan semuanya remaja.
text.53: Allah menegaskan bahwa segala macam kenikmatan yang terdapat di surga itulah yang dijanjikan kepada hamba Allah yang bertakwa, yang pasti datang setelah manusia seluruhnya dibangkitkan kembali dari kubur, dan diadili di Padang Mahsyar. Allah menegaskan bahwa nikmat yang ada di surga itu bukan sembarang kenikmatan, tetapi nikmat yang abadi.
text.54: Allah menegaskan bahwa segala macam kenikmatan yang terdapat di surga itulah yang dijanjikan kepada hamba Allah yang bertakwa, yang pasti datang setelah manusia seluruhnya dibangkitkan kembali dari kubur, dan diadili di Padang Mahsyar. Allah menegaskan bahwa nikmat yang ada di surga itu bukan sembarang kenikmatan, tetapi nikmat yang abadi.
text.55:
Pada ayat ini diterangkan keadaan orang-orang kafir di dalam neraka. Mereka memperoleh tempat kembali yang buruk, mengalami kesengsaraan yang tiada taranya di dalam neraka. Segala tempat yang mereka tempati baik tempat duduk, tempat tidur, tempat istirahat, dan sebagainya, merupakan tempat yang tidak mereka senangi, karena di tempat itu mereka selalu mengalami siksaan yang berat.

Dalam ayat yang lain diterangkan keadaan orang kafir di dalam neraka, Allah berfirman:

Bagi mereka tikar tidur dari api neraka dan di atas mereka ada selimut (api neraka). Demikianlah Kami memberi balasan kepada orang-orang yang zalim. (al-A.'raf/7: 41)
text.56:

text.57:
Allah menyatakan kepada orang-orang kafir di dalam neraka, "Hai orang kafir, inilah azab yang pernah Aku janjikan dahulu, maka rasakanlah olehmu bagaimana berat dan pedihnya azab itu, minumlah di dalam neraka itu air panas yang sedang mendidih yang membakar mulut dan usus-ususmu atau nanah busuk yang mengalir dari tubuh-tubuh penghuni neraka yang sangat dingin. Selain dari itu kamu sekalian akan merasakan azab-azab yang lain yang kamu sendiri tidak mengetahui bentuk azab itu, selain kamu hanya merasakan kesengsaraan yang luar biasa."

Rasulullah saw bersabda:

Dari Abu Sa'id al-Khudri, dari Nabi saw, beliau bersabda, "Seandainya satu timba dari minuman penghuni neraka ditumpahkan di dunia, maka semua penghuni dunia akan berbau busuk.(Riwayat al-hakim)

Jika diperhatikan ayat-ayat ini dan dihubungkan dengan ayat-ayat yang sebelumnya seakan-akan ayat ini merupakan imbangan perkataan Allah kepada ahli surga. Pada ayat yang lalu disebutkan bahwa penduduk surga diberikan buah-buahan yang baik dan minuman yang lezat rasanya, sedang pada ayat ini diterangkan bahwa penduduk neraka disuruh merasakan air panas yang mendidih dan nanah yang mengalir. Hal ini berarti bahwa penduduk surga memperoleh semua yang diminta dan diingini, sedang penduduk neraka disuruh bahkan dipaksa melakukan sesuatu yang tidak diingininya.

Kalau orang-orang yang beriman di dalam surga memperoleh bidadari yang tidak liar pandangannya dan sebaya umurnya, maka penduduk neraka memperoleh azab yang bermacam-macam yang sangat berat dan pedih.

text.59: Para malaikat berkata kepada orang-orang kafir yang telah masuk ke dalam neraka lebih dahulu di waktu mereka menghalau rombongan kafir yang lain yang banyak jumlahnya, "Inilah rombongan yang lain yang dihalau ke dalam neraka agar mereka tinggal di dalamnya bersama-sama dengan kamu." Rombongan yang telah masuk dahulu ke dalam neraka, melihat rombongan yang baru yang sedang digiring itu, berkata, "Itu adalah rombongan yang banyak jumlahnya yang akan menghuni neraka bersama-sama kita, maka kecelakaan akan menimpa mereka pula seperti kecelakaan yang telah menimpa kita dan mereka akan dibakar hangus seperti kita."
text.60:
Mendengar ucapan itu, maka rombongan yang sedang digiring malaikat itu menjawab, "Sebenarnya kamulah yang lebih pantas mendapat celaka, karena kamulah yang menyesatkan kami dahulu, dan kamulah yang selalu mengajak serta mendorong kami untuk mengerjakan pekerjaan-pekerjaan yang mengakibatkan kami masuk neraka ini."

Dalam ayat lain, Allah berfirman:

Allah berfirman, "Masuklah kamu ke dalam api neraka bersama golongan jin dan manusia yang telah lebih dahulu dari kamu. Setiap kali suatu umat masuk, dia melaknat saudaranya¦ (al-A.'raf/7: 38)

Lain halnya penduduk surga, setiap ada rombongan yang masuk ke dalamnya, mereka selalu disambut dengan senang dan gembira, dalam suasana persaudaraan dan kasih sayang, dan kepada mereka diucapkan "salam". Sungguh besar perbedaan antara penerimaan orang-orang beriman ketika mereka masuk surga dengan penerimaan orang-orang kafir ketika mereka masuk neraka.
text.61:
Bahkan penduduk neraka yang baru datang itu berdoa kepada Tuhan agar menambah azab yang berat kepada orang-orang yang telah menyesatkan mereka dengan mengatakan, "Wahai Tuhan kami, timpakanlah azab yang berlipat-ganda kepada pemimpin-pemimpin dan pemuka-pemuka agama kami yang telah menyebabkan kami menderita karena azab yang berat ini.

Ayat lain yang searti dengan ayat ini firman Allah:

¦Ya Tuhan kami, mereka telah menyesatkan kami. Datangkanlah siksaan api neraka yang berlipat ganda kepada mereka" Allah berfirman, "Masing-masing mendapatkan (siksaan) yang berlipat ganda, tapi kamu tidak mengetahui. (al-A.'raf/7: 38)
text.62:
Orang-orang kafir itu saling bertanya sesamanya, setelah mereka tidak melihat seorang pun orang-orang yang beriman yang mereka anggap hina sewaktu di dunia, "Mengapa kita tidak melihat seorang pun dari orang-orang yang sewaktu di dunia kita pandang sebagai orang bodoh, orang jahat, dan orang hina yang tidak ada kebaikan pada dirinya."

Ibnu 'Abbas berkata, "Yang mereka maksud dengan orang bodoh dan jahat adalah sahabat Rasul. Abu Jahal berkata, 'Di mana Bilal, di mana shuhaib, di mana Ammar, mereka semuanya di dalam surga. Kasihan Abu Jahal, anaknya 'Ikrimah dan Juwairiyah masuk Islam, demikian pula ibunya, saudaranya, sedang ia sendiri kafir."
text.63: Selanjutnya mereka saling bertanya sesama mereka, "Apakah karena telah kita ejek dan perolok-olokkan sewaktu di dunia, sehingga mereka tidak masuk neraka ini, sedang mereka adalah orang-orang yang tidak pantas diejek dan diperolok-olokkan. Atau mereka sebenarnya telah masuk bersama-sama kita ke dalam neraka, tetapi kita tidak melihat mereka." Demikianlah keadaan orang-orang kafir di dalam neraka, mereka saling salah menyalahkan, saling tuduh-menuduh, bahkan mereka saling bertengkar antara yang satu dengan yang lain.
text.64: Pada ayat ini Allah menegaskan bahwa semua yang diceritakan itu benar-benar akan terjadi, tidak diragukan sedikit pun. Orang-orang kafir itu akan selalu bertengkar sesama mereka di dalam neraka nanti.
text.65:
Allah memerintahkan kepada Rasul-Nya agar menyampaikan kepada orang-orang musyrik Mekah bahwa dirinya adalah rasul Allah yang menyampaikan janji dan ancaman-Nya kepada manusia. Ancaman-Nya ialah azab pedih yang akan ditimpakan kepada orang-orang yang menyalahi perintah-Nya sebagaimana yang telah ditimpakan kepada orang-orang sebelumnya, seperti kaum 'Ad, Samud, dan sebagainya. Selanjutnya Rasulullah saw menyatakan bahwa dia hanya pemberi berita dan bukanlah tukang sihir sebagaimana yang mereka tuduhkan dan bukan pula orang pendusta. Ia bukanlah seorang yang berkuasa atas manusia, sebagaimana diterangkan dalam firman Allah:

Maka berilah peringatan, karena sesungguhnya engkau (Muhammad) hanyalah pemberi peringatan. Engkau bukanlah orang yang berkuasa atas mereka. (al-Gasyiyah/88: 21-22)

Allah menerangkan tugas seorang rasul dan batas-batas kemampuannya. Dia menerangkan ajaran yang harus disampaikan kepada orang-orang kafir yaitu: Tidak ada satu pun Tuhan yang berhak disembah kecuali Allah, Tuhan Yang Maha Esa, tiada sekutu bagi-Nya.
text.66: Dialah Tuhan yang tidak dapat ditandingi oleh siapa pun. Tuhan Yang Maha Esa Mahaperkasa, Mahakuasa, menguasai, mengatur, mengawasi, dan memelihara kelangsungan hidup segala sesuatu yang ada di langit dan bumi. Dialah Tuhan Yang Maha Mengampuni segala dosa-dosa hamba yang dikehendaki-Nya.
text.67: Nabi Muhammad diperintahkan untuk mengatakan kepada orang-orang musyrik bahwa berita tentang rasul atau utusan Allah yang memberi peringatan kepada manusia dan berita keesaan dan kekuasaan-Nya, adalah berita yang sangat besar faedahnya bagi seluruh manusia. Berita itu dapat menyelamatkan manusia dari kesesatan, dapat menunjukkan kepada manusia jalan yang lurus, jalan kebahagiaan hidup di dunia dan akhirat. Akan tetapi, kebanyakan manusia tidak mau mengerti bahkan mereka berpaling dari agama Allah.

text.71:
Pada ayat ini dijelaskan bahwa para malaikat dan iblis mengajukan pertanyaan kepada Allah setelah Dia menyampaikan kepada malaikat bahwa akan menciptakan seorang manusia dari tanah. Pernyataan mereka mengenai faedah adanya manusia yang akan diciptakan Allah itu. Pertanyaan ini diterangkan dalam firman Allah:

Dan (ingatlah) ketika Tuhanmu berfirman kepada para malaikat, "Aku hendak menjadikan khalifah di bumi." Mereka berkata, "Apakah Engkau hendak menjadikan orang yang merusak dan menumpahkan darah di sana, sedangkan kami bertasbih memuji-Mu dan menyucikan nama-Mu?" Dia berfirman, "Sungguh, Aku mengetahui apa yang tidak kamu ketahui." (al-Baqarah/2: 30)

Mengenai penciptaan manusia dari tanah, dijelaskan disini bahwa berdasarkan kajian ilmiah bahan penciptaan manusia adalah tanah, disebut lebih persis pada ayat ini yaitu tanah liat. Istilah liat biasa dipakai untuk menamai butiran tanah dengan ukuran paling kecil, diameter di bawah 0,5 mikron (= 1/2000 mm). Istilah liat juga biasa dipakai untuk menamai jenis mineral pembentuk butiran tanah paling kecil ini. Karena ukurannya yang kecil, liat bila dimasukkan ke dalam air akan bersifat koloidal: tidak melarut tetapi tersebar merata dan sulit dipisahkan dari air. Sebagai mineral, liat adalah sekelompok alumino-silikat hidrat yang strukturnya berlembar. Karena strukturnya, partikel liat mempunyai muatan elektrik. Sifat-sifat mineral liat lainnya adalah plastis, tetapi plastisitas ini menghilang apabila dipanaskan sampai temperatur tertentu karena struktur mineral berubah. Pemanfaatan liat secara tradisional didasarkan pada sifat-sifat fisiknya, antara lain karena mudah dibentuk dan mengeras jika dipanaskan dipanaskan, sehingga umum dipakai sebagai bahan pembuat barang gerabah atau tembikar dan keramik. Pemanfaatan liat secara modern lebih didasarkan pada sifat kimia-fisiknya, umumnya dipakai sebagai bahan katalis pada reaksi-reaksi kimia. Karena sifat-sifat kimia-fisik yang dimilikinya, liat merupakan bagian tanah yang paling mungkin memiliki peran besar pada proses terbentuknya awal kehidupan di muka bumi termasuk penciptaan manusia (lihat juga al-An'am/6: 2, Fathir/35: 11; al-hijr/15: 26-28-33; al-Mu'minun/23: 12, 14; ash-shaffat/37: 11)
text.72:
Allah menyampaikan kepada malaikat bahwa apabila Ia telah menyempurnakan kejadian manusia dan meniupkan roh ke dalam tubuhnya, mereka diperintahkan untuk sujud kepada Adam, sebagai tanda penghormatan kepadanya.

Pada ayat ini diterangkan salah satu proses penciptaan Adam, yaitu dari tanah. Para malaikat bersujud menghormatinya, karena taat kepada Allah, kecuali Iblis. Ia enggan menghormati Adam, sehingga ia termasuk makhluk yang tidak taat kepada Allah. Pembangkangan Iblis terhadap perintah sujud kepada Adam telah disebutkan dalam firmannya:

Dan (ingatlah) ketika Kami berfirman kepada para malaikat, "Sujudlah kamu kepada Adam!" Maka mereka pun sujud kecuali Iblis. Ia menolak dan menyombongkan diri, dan ia termasuk golongan yang kafir. (al-Baqarah/2: 34)

text.75:
Allah berkata kepada Iblis, "Hai Iblis, apa yang menyebabkanmu enggan sujud menghormati Adam, makhluk yang telah Aku ciptakan sendiri dengan kekuasaan-Ku? Aku sendirilah yang menciptakan Adam itu, bukan makhluk-Ku yang menciptakannya. Kenapa kamu berlaku angkuh dan sombong. Apakah kamu telah merasa dirimu lebih tinggi dan lebih terhormat di antara makhluk-makhluk yang telah Aku ciptakan, sehingga kamu berpendapat bahwa kamu berhak dan berwenang berbuat apa yang kamu inginkan?"

Iblis menjawab dan memberikan alasan pembangkangannya. Ia mengatakan bahwa ia lebih baik daripada Adam karena Allah menjadikannya dari api, sedang Adam dari tanah. Menurut Iblis, api lebih baik daripada tanah karena sifat api selalu meninggi dan tanah selalu di bawah. Padahal, materi asal itu tidak bisa dijadikan indikator kemuliaan makhluk. Kemuliaan itu tergantung pada ketaatan dan kepatuhan kepada Allah. Percakapan di atas disebutkan dalam firman Allah:

(Allah) berfirman, "Apakah yang menghalangimu (sehingga) kamu tidak bersujud (kepada Adam) ketika Aku menyuruhmu?" (Iblis) menjawab, "Aku lebih baik daripada dia. Engkau ciptakan aku dari api, sedangkan dia Engkau ciptakan dari tanah."(al-A.'raf/7: 12)

text.77:
Karena kedurhakaan Iblis yang enggan menaati perintah Allah, maka Allah mengusir Iblis dari surga, dan menjadikannya sebagai makhluk yang terkutuk. Kutukan itu tetap berlaku sampai hari Kiamat, yaitu hari pembalasan terhadap semua perbuatan manusia.

Firman Allah:

(Allah) berfirman, "Maka turunlah kamu darinya (surga); karena kamu tidak sepatutnya menyombongkan diri di dalamnya. Keluarlah! Sesungguhnya kamu termasuk makhluk yang hina."( al-A.'raf/7: 13)

text.79: Setelah menjadi makhluk yang terkutuk, Iblis memohon kepada Allah, "Wahai Tuhanku, jika Engkau telah menjadikan aku sebagai makhluk-Mu yang terkutuk dan telah terjauh dari rahmat-Mu, maka aku mohon agar umurku dipanjangkan, hingga sampai hari kebangkitan nanti. Janganlah engkau wafatkan aku selama dunia masih ada."
text.80:
Allah mengabulkan permohonan Iblis itu dengan membiarkannya hidup sampai waktu yang ditentukan, sebagaimana firman Allah:

(Iblis) menjawab, "Berilah aku penangguhan waktu, sampai hari mereka dibangkitkan."(Allah) berfirman, "Benar, kamu termasuk yang diberi penangguhan waktu."( al-A.'raf/7: 14-15)

text.82: Selanjutnya Iblis memohon lagi, "Wahai Tuhanku, demi kekuasaan dan kemuliaan Engkau, berilah aku kesempatan untuk menggoda dan menyesatkan manusia dari jalan Engkau, dengan menjadikan mereka memandang baik perbuatan buruk dan maksiat yang mereka kerjakan."
text.83: Selanjutnya Iblis mengatakan, "Tentu saja hamba-hamba Engkau yang kuat imannya, yang tunduk dan patuh kepada Engkau, tidak dapat aku goda dan sesatkan. Hanya orang-orang kafir seperti aku dan orang-orang yang lemah imannya yang mungkin aku sesatkan."

Neraka Jahanam itu aku penuhi dengan engkau dan anak cucumu yang datang kemudian dan yang mengikuti engkau dalam kesesatan dari sebagian anak cucu Adam. Allah mengancam orang-orang yang menjadikan setan sebagai pemimpin-pemimpin mereka dan mengabaikan perintah Allah yang menghantarkan mereka kepada kebahagiaan di dunia dan akhirat, Allah berfirman:

text.86:
Allah memerintahkan kepada Rasulullah saw agar menyampaikan kepada orang-orang musyrik bahwa ia tidak mengharapkan apalagi meminta upah kepada mereka sebagai imbalan dari tugas menyampaikan agama Allah. Sedikit pun Rasul tidak mengharapkannya. Hanya Allah yang akan memberi upah padanya. Orang-orang telah mengenal rasul dengan sebaik-baiknya bahwa ia tidak pernah mengada-ada dan membuat yang bukan-bukan."

Dari ayat ini dipahami agar orang-orang yang beriman meniru apa yang telah diperbuat Rasulullah, yaitu selalu menyampaikan agama Allah kepada manusia, walaupun hanya sedikit yang diketahuinya. Imam Muslim meriwayatkan bahwa Ibnu Mas'ud berkata:

text.1:
Allah begins His word with Fawatih as-Suwar "shad," just as He began several surahs revealed in Mecca and two surahs revealed in Medina. Regarding the interpretation of Fawatih as-Suwar, it has been extensively discussed in the interpretation of the first verse of the second surah (al-Baqarah in Al-Qur'an dan Tafsirnya Volume 1).

Then Allah swears by the Qur'an, which possesses the magnificence of its contents, the nobility of its status, and the perfection of its laws, which are magnificent and amazing.

The Qur'an is described as "possessing magnificence" so that people understand that the Qur'an revealed to His Messenger is truly from Allah and contains true teachings conveyed by the Messenger of Allah to all mankind.
text.2:
Allah reveals the state of the disbelievers of Mecca who deny the truth of revelation and cannot see its values, which are actually very important for their well-being in this world and happiness in the hereafter, because of the arrogance and hostility that are entrenched in their souls.

Their arrogance is evident in their actions towards the Messenger and his followers. They greatly belittled the Muslims because they felt stronger and had more wealth. Meanwhile, the Muslims consisted of poor people and were few in number.

That fierce hostility was due to the teachings brought by the Messenger threatening the religion of their ancestors and humiliating the idols they had made into objects of worship besides Allah.
text.3:
Allah condemns their arrogance and hostility by explaining how many communities before them, who insulted and denied the messengers of Allah, were destroyed by Him. When the punishment was inflicted, they asked for help from Allah. However, that request was useless, and they would not be able to escape from the devastating torment.

Allah says:

"Then when they saw Our punishment, they said, "We believe in Allah alone and disbelieve in that which we used to associate with Him." (al-Mu'min/40: 84)

And His saying:

"Then when they sensed Our punishment, at once they fled from it. Do not flee but return to that in which you were given luxury and to your homes - perhaps you will be questioned." (al-Anbiya'/21: 12-13)
text.4:
This verse reveals the state of the disbelievers of Mecca who were greatly astonished when the prophet who came to them turned out to be an ordinary human being from among them. According to them, Muhammad, who claimed to have been appointed as a messenger, had no special qualities, neither physical nor spiritual, even though the position of a messenger is high. Therefore, it was impossible for Muhammad to occupy such a high position. That is why they said that Muhammad was merely a sorcerer. He was a deceiver and a liar. What he conveyed, whether in the form of commands or prohibitions that he claimed came from Allah, was a lie. Allah says:

"Is it a wonder to the people that We have sent Our inspiration to a man from among themselves, - (saying): 'Warn mankind (of the coming judgment), and give good tidings to those who believe, that they have an elevated rank with their Lord'? (But) the Unbelievers say: 'This is indeed an evident sorcerer!'" (Yunus/10:2)
text.5:
The *sabab nuzul* (circumstances of revelation) of this verse, as narrated by Ibn Jarir ath-Thabari from Ibn 'Abbas, states that after Abu Talib fell ill, a group of Quraysh people, including Abu Jahl, entered. They said, "Indeed, your nephew insults our gods. He truly does and says it. How good it would be if you sent someone to forbid him." So Abu Talib sent a messenger to him. Then the Prophet came and entered his house, while the distance between the Quraysh people and Abu Talib was very close, only enough seating for one person. Ibn 'Abbas said that Abu Jahl was worried that the Prophet would sit next to Abu Talib. Then he would become lenient. So he jumped and sat in the unoccupied place beside Abu Talib. Thus, the Messenger of Allah did not get a seat near his uncle. He sat near the door. Then Abu Talib said to him, "O my nephew, why are your people complaining about you? They accuse you of insulting their gods and that you say such and such." Ibn 'Abbas continued that the Quraysh people spoke a lot with Abu Talib.

Then the Messenger of Allah said, "O my Uncle. Indeed, I want them to declare just one sentence, with which the Arabs will submit to them, and the 'Ajam (non-Arabs) will pay *jizyah* (head tax) to them." So they were pleased with the sentence (that was proposed) and also pleased with the words of the Messenger. Then the Quraysh people asked, "What is that sentence? By your father, we will certainly give you ten times the reward." The Messenger of Allah then said, "*La ilaha ilallah*." Then they got up trembling, while rolling up their sleeves and said, "Why does he make the gods into One God? Indeed, this is truly a surprising thing." Then this verse was revealed.

Allah explains the astonishment of the polytheists at the call of the Messenger. They were astonished why Muhammad made God only one, this is contrary to the beliefs of their ancestors. When the Messenger of Allah invited them to abandon their many deities and replace them with worshiping Allah, the One and Only, then they considered that Muhammad's call was not a trivial matter, but truly something astonishing. They denied the call because they were sure that their ancestors could not have held a false belief, but Muhammad was a liar who claimed himself to be right.
text.6:
In this verse, Allah explains that the Quraysh leaders left Abu Talib's house after being silenced by the Messenger's response, as explained in the *asbabun nuzul* above. They knew that Muhammad was resolute in defending his religion. That is why they no longer had any hope of softening Muhammad's heart through his uncle's mediation. They discussed what should be done and racked their brains to find a solution. Finally, they decided to strengthen the conviction of their followers to remain with their beliefs and continue to worship their gods.

At the end of the verse, Allah reveals the words of the Quraysh leaders to their followers, that worshipping idols is what Allah actually desires.
text.7: Allah explains another reason put forward by the Quraysh leaders to their followers, that the call of Muhammad (peace and blessings be upon him) was not true. They said that they had never heard a call like the one proclaimed by Muhammad in the last revealed religion. The religion they meant was Christianity. Muhammad's call for people to believe in the oneness of God was merely a lie fabricated by Muhammad (peace and blessings be upon him) and did not come from Allah.
text.8:
Then Allah explains the denial of the disbelievers of Mecca that Muhammad was given revelation, even though he was an ordinary human being. According to their assumption, the one who deserves to be appointed as a messenger is someone who possesses glory and leadership that exceeds them. Muhammad did not have such special qualities, so it was impossible for the Qur'an to be revealed to him. Whereas among them there were still people who were more noble and more worthy of holding leadership.

Allah says:

And they say, "Why was this Qur'an not sent down upon a great man from [one of] the two cities?" (az-Zukhruf/43: 31)

They denied Muhammad's revelation and prophethood because, according to their way of thinking, the person sent as a messenger is someone who is very rich and influential. They did not realize that Allah has the power to determine choices according to His will, including appointing His servant as a Prophet.

Allah says:

And they say, "What sort of messenger is this who eats food and walks in the markets? Why has there not been sent down to him an angel so he would be a warner with him? Or [why is not] a treasure cast down upon him, or does he have a garden from which he eats?" And the wrongdoers say, "You follow not but a man affected by magic." (al-Furqan/25: 7-8)

In the final part, this verse explains that the reason they are far from the truth is because their hearts are shrouded in doubt that cannot be penetrated by the light of the truth of the Qur'an, and they have not yet felt Allah's painful torment. If they had paid attention to the signs of the truth of the revelation sent down to His messenger, they would have acknowledged his prophethood, because the revelation received was sufficient to be a sign of his prophethood. However, because of the disease of envy and jealousy that had nested in their chests, they did not want to accept the revelation. Finally, they fell into the valley of denial.
text.9:
In this verse, Allah rebukes the Quraysh people who rejected the prophethood of Muhammad because he was not a prominent figure among them. Allah commands His Messenger to ask whether they possess the power to determine and distribute the treasures of Allah's mercy.

At the end of the verse, Allah mentions His attributes of being the All-Mighty and the All-Bestowing. An Almightiness that cannot be matched by anyone and an All-Bestowing nature that cannot be hindered by any other power.

Allah says:

"And your Lord creates and chooses whom He wills; not for them was the choice." (al-Qashash/28: 68)

And His saying:

"...Allah is most knowing of where He places His message..." (al-An'am/6: 124)
text.10:
Then Allah commanded His Messenger to ask the Quraysh about their attitude of denial and arrogance. This question contains mockery because they truly do not have any power whatsoever over the heavens, the earth, and what is within them. If they feel they have no power whatsoever in the universe, they should not interfere in the appointment of a messenger, which is a matter of the unseen (ghaib), the power of which rests with the All-Powerful and All-Great.

At the end of the verse, Allah commands His Messenger to challenge them to climb ladders to the heavens, and to seek ways to hinder the revelation (wahyu) brought to Allah's chosen messenger. Indeed, they will not be able to do so. Thus, it is clear that their denial of revelation is only due to an attitude of hasad (envy).
text.11:
In this verse, Allah explains that the state of the polytheists of Mecca who denied the prophethood of Muhammad and rejected the religion of monotheism was like a large army, a combination of army units. This allied army, moving to destroy the Muslims, would surely be defeated, because the foundation of their struggle was not based on firm belief, but only on envy and arrogance.

The event described in this verse did not occur at the time the verse was revealed, because at that time the Muslims did not yet have an army, the number of their followers was still small, and there were no signs of building a force that could defeat the allied army as described in the verse. However, the event only occurred at the time of the Battle of Badr, where the polytheists, whose numbers were many times greater than the Muslims, were defeated with the help of Allah. Allah says:

Or do they say, "We are a united body, bound to prevail?" Soon their multitude will be defeated, and they will turn their backs [in flight]. Nay, the Hour is their appointed time, and the Hour will be more grievous and more bitter. (al-Qamar/54: 44-46)

The explanation given by Allah to His Messenger in this verse is one of the miracles of the Prophet and at the same time a sign of the truth of the revelation he received, that the revelation was truly from Allah and not made up by Muhammad.
text.12:
In these two verses, Allah explains six communities that denied Allah's messengers, as well as the consequences they suffered, with the intention of providing a lesson for the polytheists of Mecca, so that they would be freed from error and willing to accept guidance. They are:

First, the people of Noah who accused Prophet Noah of giving fabricated advice and warnings. Therefore, they mocked him, even saying that Prophet Noah was crazy. Although Prophet Noah had repeatedly called upon them gently to embrace monotheism, their challenges did not diminish, but rather increased, until Prophet Noah prayed to Allah.

Allah says:

And Noah said, "My Lord, do not leave upon the earth from among the disbelievers an inhabitant. Indeed, if You leave them, they will mislead Your servants and not beget except [a succession of] wicked doers and [confirmed] disbelievers." (Nuh/71: 26-27)

The people of Noah continued to deny his call, even sinking into error. Allah destroyed them through storms, hurricanes, and floods as a reward for the evil they committed. However, Noah and his followers were saved by Allah from that torment.

Allah says:

So We opened the gates of the heaven with rain pouring down. And We caused the earth to burst with springs, and the waters met for a matter already decreed. And We carried him on a [construction of] planks and nails, Floating under Our observation as reward for he who had been denied. (al-Qamar/54: 11-14)

Second, the people of 'Ad who denied the call of Hud who invited them to worship Allah the One and Only and leave the deities they associated with Allah. However, the people of 'Ad opposed the call, even mocking Hud and calling him crazy. That is why they were destroyed by a very cold and strong wind.

Allah says:

And as for 'Aad, they were destroyed by a screaming, violent wind. Which He imposed upon them for seven nights and eight days in succession, so you would see the people therein fallen as if they were hollow trunks of palm trees. Then do you see of them any remnant? (al-haqqah/69: 6-8)

Third, Pharaoh who had a large army. In addition, he had a special torture chamber to torture his enemies and tall and sturdy buildings. Allah had sent Moses to Pharaoh and his followers to stop their error and worship Allah the One and Only. The truth of Moses' call was also strengthened by miracles. However, Pharaoh and his followers remained stubborn in rejecting Moses' call, even being arrogant and insulting him by declaring that he was the most high god. So Allah commanded Moses to evacuate his people to escape Pharaoh's cruelty. Thus, Moses and the Children of Israel were saved from Pharaoh's pursuit while he and his army drowned in the waves of the sea.

Allah says:

And We took the Children of Israel across the sea, and Pharaoh and his soldiers pursued them in tyranny and enmity until, when drowning overtook him, he said, "I believe that there is no deity except that in whom the Children of Israel believe, and I am of the Muslims." Now? And you had disobeyed [Him] before and were of the corrupters. So today We will save you in body that you may be a sign to those after you. And indeed, many among the people, of Our signs, are heedless. (Yunus/10: 90-92)

Another meaning of *autad* is the shackles used by Pharaoh to torture. Some also say that Pharaoh had a magnificent and sturdy palace.

Fourth, the people of Thamud who denied the call of Prophet Saleh who was sent to them. They had committed transgressions that exceeded the limits. They had slaughtered the camel that should have been cared for. As a reward for their disobedience, Allah inflicted a loud, thundering sound, until they were destroyed like dry grass.

Allah says:

Thamud denied the warners. Then they said, "Is it one man from among ourselves that we should follow? Indeed, we would then be in error and madness. Has the Reminder been sent down upon him from among us? Rather, he is an insolent liar." They will know tomorrow who is the insolent liar. Indeed, We are sending the she-camel as trial for them, so watch them and be patient. And inform them that the water is to be shared between them, each drinking [by] turn. But they called their companion, and he dared and hamstrung [her]. And how [severe] was My punishment and warning. Indeed, We sent upon them one shout, and they became as [dry] twigs of an [animal] pen. (al-Qamar/54: 23-31)

Fifth, Prophet Lot was also denied by his people. He repeatedly warned his people to fear Allah and abandon the vile act of homosexuality, but they still did not heed him. Allah then commanded Lot and his family to leave Sodom because they would be punished with a destructive torment.

Allah says:

The people of Lot denied the warners. Indeed, We sent upon them a storm of stones, except the family of Lot - We saved them before dawn. (al-Qamar/54: 33-34)

Sixth, A.shhabul Aikah, who were the people of Prophet Shuaib, also denied their prophet. Prophet Shuaib invited them to worship Allah the One and Only, forbade them from associating partners with Him, and not to reduce the scales. However, his people not only rejected the call, but they even conspired to oppose it. That is why they were destroyed by lightning that struck them in the dark.

Allah says:

Then cause to fall upon us pieces of the sky, if you should be of the truthful." He said, "My Lord is most knowing of what you do." And they denied him, so the punishment of the Day of the Black Cloud seized them. Indeed, it was the punishment of a terrible day. (asy-Syu'ara'/26: 187-189)

text.14: Allah explains the reason they received punishment and experienced destruction, which is because those past communities denied the calls of Allah's messengers. Therefore, it was fitting that they received punishment and experienced destruction. The stories of past communities are presented to the polytheists of Mecca as a warning so that they might realize and be willing to change their attitude of denying the call of the Messenger and instead become a community that is obedient and accepts his call. This story also serves as comfort and encouragement to the believers to be steadfast in facing the torment and humiliation of the enemies of Allah. This enemy becomes an example for them that the struggle to defend the religion of monotheism will certainly receive help from Allah and will surely end in victory.
text.15: In this verse, Allah threatens the polytheists of Mecca who refuse to change their denial of the Messenger, with a threat in the form of an extremely loud and swift cry, as a sign of the coming of the Day of Judgment which will destroy. At that time, they will have no opportunity to avoid the destruction that comes suddenly and without any delay.
text.16:
In this verse, Allah reveals the denial of the disbelievers of Mecca regarding the punishment threatened upon them. They mocked the Messenger of Allah after hearing that the punishment threatened upon them was the punishment of the Day of Judgment. They asked Allah to hasten the coming of the punishment threatened upon them and not to wait until the Day of Reckoning arrives.

Allah says:

"And (remember) when they said, "O Allah, if this (the Qur'an) is indeed the truth from You, then rain down upon us stones from the sky or bring us a painful punishment." (al-Anfal/8: 32)

According to the narration of Imam an-Nasa'i from Ibn 'Abbas, the one who asked for Allah's punishment to be hastened was an-Nadhir bin al-harits bin 'Alaqah bin Kaladah. An-Nadhir died killed in the Battle of Badr.

What is meant by the Day of Reckoning is the day when every person's deeds are examined, with a thorough examination, in order to receive a reward that is in accordance with their deeds. The occurrence of the Day of Reckoning is preceded by a loud cry that destroys all life on the Day of Judgment.
text.17:
Allah commands the Messenger of Allah and his followers to remain patient in the face of whatever the polytheists say, even if it is insult and denial. Such things did not only befall the Messenger of Allah and his followers, but also the prophets who were sent before. For those who believe, the denial and persecution that come from the enemies of Allah do not diminish their spirit of struggle in upholding the religion of monotheism, but rather become an impetus to continue defending the truth of monotheism and continue fighting to destroy polytheism.

Allah commands the Messenger of Allah to remind his people of the story of Prophet David, who possessed strength. The strength meant in this verse is strength in obeying Allah and strength in understanding the religion. Obedience to Allah and his knowledge of religion are reflected in his actions of always striving to carry out the mandate, spreading the call to embrace the religion of monotheism, without showing the slightest weakness.

Prophet David was known as the prophet who was strongest in worship. He used a third of the night for prayer, and fasted every other day.

Regarding David's obedience to his Lord, it is further explained in several hadith as follows:

The most beloved fast to Allah is the fast of David. He fasted one day and broke his fast the next. The most beloved prayer to Allah Ta'ala is the prayer of David. He slept for half the night, and prayed for a third of it, then slept again for a sixth of it. (Narrated by Ahmad, al-Bukhari, Muslim, Abu Dawud, and an-Nasa'i from Ibn 'Umar)

From this narration, it can be understood that Prophet David always returned everything to Allah in all matters. If he felt guilty, or if it crossed his mind that there was a fault in himself, then he always asked forgiveness from Allah.

Imam al-Hakim narrated from Abu ad-Darda' who stated:

Whenever the Prophet (Muhammad) saw mentioned Prophet David or talked about him, he described him as the most devoted person in worship.

Imam adh-Dailami narrated from Ibn 'Umar who stated that the Messenger of Allah saw said:

It is not appropriate for someone to say that I worship more than Prophet David.

These narrations show that Prophet David was a prophet who was very obedient to Allah, as affirmed by Allah at the end of this verse.
text.18:
In these verses, Allah mentions several blessings that have been bestowed upon David.

Firstly, that Allah has subjected the mountains to glorify Him together with David in the evening and morning. Such an expression implies that Prophet David was always obedient in worshiping Allah. He always glorified Him, praising His greatness morning and evening. Allah equates David's obedience with the obedience of the mountains to show how profound Prophet David's obedience was. As for the obedience of the mountains in glorifying Allah, it is in the reality that the mountains follow Allah's unchanging sunnah, which is certainly different from the obedience of humans.

Allah says:

And there is not a thing but that it exalts [Allah] with praise, but you do not understand their [way of] exalting. (al-Isra'/17: 44)

If someone carefully observes the meaning and usefulness of the creation of mountains for humans, and also pays attention to their function in the best possible way, then he will know that mountains are one of the causes of rainfall, which gives life to humans. They also serve as a medium for storing water during the rainy season, which they channel during the dry season, and the minerals they spew out become fertilizers for agricultural land. Likewise, in their depths are all kinds of minerals that are very necessary for the interests of human life's equipment. The mountains carry out their duties in the best possible way and never deviate from the prevailing provisions.

Allah further explains that He also subjected the birds that always glorify Him together with Prophet David. A similar expression implies how beautiful Prophet David's voice was when reading the book of Psalms (Zabur), so that it seemed as if the vibration of his voice could captivate the birds that were flying in the sky. It is depicted as if the birds that were flying stopped in the air because they heard the voice of Prophet David who was glorifying Allah, and also joined in glorifying Him together with him.

The glorification of birds is not the same as the glorification of humans. Birds have their own way of expressing the greatness of Allah.

After that, Allah affirms that each of the creatures mentioned earlier, namely the mountains and birds, are submissive, conquered, and obedient to Allah's provisions for the benefit of mankind.

In this verse, there is a hint for the polytheists of Mecca, firstly that if the mountains and birds that were created without reason always obey Allah's provisions, then they who were created as more perfect creatures and equipped with reason should be more obedient to Allah's laws. If the opposite happens, it means that something unnatural has happened to them.

Secondly, Allah has strengthened the kingdom of Prophet David with a large army, abundant wealth, a highly respected personality, and skill in arranging war strategies so that he always achieves victory.

Thirdly, Allah has bestowed upon him wisdom. What is meant by wisdom in this verse is prophethood, perfection of knowledge, and accuracy in carrying out deeds, as well as accurate understanding.

Among the knowledge that Allah gave to Prophet David is as mentioned in Allah's word:

And We softened iron for him, [commanding], "Make complete coats of mail and calculate [precisely] the links," and work [all of you] righteousness. Indeed I, of what you do, am Seeing. (Saba'/34: 10-11)

While what is meant by his accuracy in carrying out deeds is that he did not want to start any deed unless he knew why and for what the deed was done.

Fourthly, Allah has bestowed upon him wisdom in resolving disputes. In resolving disputes, he always examines the parties based on convincing evidence, far from biased traits, and free from the influence of lust. To seek the true conviction that can be used as an appropriate basis for deciding a case requires extensive knowledge, a gentle attitude, mastery of the disputed issue, and strong patience.

text.21: Allah mentions one of the interesting events in the story of Prophet David. This story begins with a question directed to the Messenger of Allah and his followers, to show that the story in question is truly attention-grabbing and worthy of emulation. The interesting story is that of the litigants who came to Prophet David. David was in his place of worship at that time. Prophet David was startled because he suspected they had come to deceive him. Prophet David suspected this because they came in an unusual way and at an unusual time. At that moment, they asked David not to be afraid. Furthermore, they explained that they had a case that had to be decided, and asked that their case be decided with a fair decision, and not deviating from the truth.
text.22: Allah mentions one of the interesting events in the story of Prophet David. This story begins with a question directed to the Messenger of Allah and his followers, to show that the story is truly attention-grabbing and worthy of emulation. The interesting story is that of the litigants who came to Prophet David. David was in his place of worship at that time. Prophet David was startled because he thought they had come to deceive him. Prophet David suspected this because they came in an unusual way and at an unusual time. At that moment, they asked David not to be afraid. Furthermore, they explained that they had a case that had to be decided, and asked that their case be decided with a fair decision, and not deviating from the truth.
text.23: In this verse, Allah explains what they made the matter into. One of them explained that his brother had ninety-nine sheep. While he himself only had one sheep. His brother demanded that he hand over the sheep he owned. Because his brother was clever at twisting the facts, while he himself did not have strong evidence to refute it, he felt defeated and had to hand over his one sheep to his brother. That was the matter they brought to the Prophet David with the intention of obtaining a fair decision.
text.24:
In this verse, it is explained that Prophet Daud (David) decided the matter by saying that the defendant had wronged the plaintiff, because the defendant had taken the plaintiff's sheep to own, so that his sheep became more numerous.

This verse does not explain further whether Prophet Daud, after receiving information from the plaintiff, also requested information from the defendant. Nor is it explained whether Prophet Daud's answer was based on evidence that provided certainty. According to the apparent understanding in the verse, Prophet Daud only gave an answer after receiving information from the plaintiff's side. Even though it is possible that the plaintiff presented information that contradicted reality, or because the way the words were presented was arranged in such a way that it gave the impression that the plaintiff was an honest person. Prophet Daud should not have given an answer hastily, or should have postponed his answer until he obtained true certainty.

Judging from the way they entered to meet Daud by climbing the fence, and the inappropriate time, and the issue raised, they did not actually intend to ask Daud for a decision, but they had another intention. Only because of Prophet Daud's vigilance, were they unable to carry out their plan. In history, it can be known that the Children of Israel often tried to kill their prophets, for example, they killed Ilyasa' and Zakaria. It is reasonable to suspect that these two people (the plaintiff and the defendant) actually wanted to persecute Prophet Daud, but they did not carry out their evil intentions because their intentions were known beforehand.

Then Allah explains Daud's answer in more detail. Daud said to the people who were in dispute that most people who form partnerships, oppress their other members. This happens because of the nature of hasad (envy), jealousy, and indulging in hawa nafsu (desires), so that the rights of one member are taken by another member. Except for those whose hearts are full of faith and love righteous deeds, who are spared from evil deeds.

At the end of the verse, Allah explains that Prophet Daud realized that he was being tested by Allah. Then he asked forgiveness from Allah for his mistake, while prostrating in repentance to Him because he felt the shortcomings and mistakes that were in himself.

The mistakes and shortcomings that befell him were his haste in giving an answer to the people who were in dispute, even though he had not obtained the certainty and evidence that he should have obtained. He decided only based on his assumption that the arrival of the people who wanted to deceive him was a test from Allah, even though what he suspected did not happen.
text.25: Then Allah explained that He had granted forgiveness to David for the mistake he realized. Allah assessed that his high awareness of the events he experienced, and the sharpness of his conscience regarding what stirred in his heart, as well as his obedience to Allah, as a sign that he had a close position with Allah. Such a servant of Allah is the one who deserves a good place of return, namely the Garden of Na'im, which is full of delights.
text.26:
In this verse, Allah explains the appointment of Prophet Daud (David) as a ruler and enforcer of law among his people. Allah states that He appointed Daud as a ruler who governed his people. The meaning of ruler is expressed with *khalifah*, which means successor, as an indication that Daud, in exercising his power, should always be adorned with good manners that are pleasing to Allah, and in implementing regulations, he should be guided by Allah's guidance. Thus, the qualities of Allah's *khalifah* are reflected in his own person. His people will certainly obey all his regulations and his exemplary behavior.

Furthermore, Allah explains that He commanded Prophet Daud to make decisions regarding matters that occur between people with fair decisions based on the revelation that was sent down to him. In that revelation, there are laws that regulate human welfare in this world and their happiness in the hereafter. Therefore, Allah forbade Prophet Daud from following his desires in carrying out all kinds of affairs related to the welfare and happiness of mankind in this world and the hereafter.

In this verse, there is an indication that shows the appointment of Daud as a messenger and the tasks that a messenger should carry out, which contains lessons for subsequent leaders in carrying out their leadership.

At the end of the verse, Allah explains the consequences for those who follow their desires and what punishment is appropriate to be imposed on them.

Following one's desires causes a person to lose consciousness. Thus, he will lose personal control so that he strays from the path that is pleasing to Allah. Then, when that error has enveloped a person's heart, he forgets the belief that is inherent in his heart that above his power there is still one who is more powerful. That is why those who follow their desires are threatened with a severe threat, the suffering of which they will feel on the Day of Reckoning, the day when all human deeds are calculated to be given appropriate rewards.
text.27:
Allah explains that He did not create the heavens, the earth, and whatever is in between them in vain. The heavens with all the stars that adorn them, the sun that emits its rays during the day, and the moon that shows its changing forms from night to night, are very beneficial to mankind. Likewise, the earth with all its contents, both visible on the surface and stored in its depths, is of great significance to human life. All of this was created by Allah through His power and will as a priceless mercy.

If people carefully observe the creatures in this universe, they will surely know that all creatures are subject to and obedient to the prevailing provisions, which cannot be avoided. This is also the case in the creation of humans. They cannot escape Allah's provisions; as soon as they are born, they are subject to the earth's gravity, they breathe with oxygen, and so on. No human being ever deviates from this provision. When they mature, they need companions to fill the emptiness of their souls, and to fulfill their life's purpose, they develop offspring. Then, when death comes, they return to their origin. They will be resurrected in the afterlife to account for all their deeds when they lived in the world.

Allah says:

"And fear the Day when you will be returned to Allah. Then every soul will be compensated for what it earned, and they will not be treated unjustly." (al-Baqarah/2: 281)

If humans think clearly and sincerely, they will certainly acknowledge the oneness and power of Allah over all that exists in the heavens, the earth, and all the creatures in between. If humans acknowledge Allah's omnipotence, they will certainly also acknowledge His power to send down revelation to His chosen servants.

Then Allah explains the attitude of the disbelievers of Mecca. They do not want to pay attention to the signs of Allah's power in the heavens and the earth, and they also do not want to examine the signs of Allah's greatness in themselves. That is why they deny the oneness of Allah and the Day of Resurrection.

Allah says:

"And We did not create the heavens and the earth and that between them in play. We did not create them except in truth (bi al-haq), but most of them do not know." (ad-Dukhan/44: 38-39)

And His saying:

"Then did you think that We created you uselessly (without purpose) and that to Us you would not be returned?" (al-Mu'minun/23: 115)

At the end of the verse, Allah affirms that they will experience a reality different from what they thought during their life in the world. They will feel the hell of wail, which is indeed prepared as a punishment for them, as a fitting reward for their denial of the oneness of Allah, the truth of revelation, and the occurrence of the Day of Resurrection.
text.28:
In this verse, Allah explains that among His wisdom is not to consider equal His servants who do good deeds with those who fall into the valley of disobedience. It is not befitting for Allah, with all His majesty, to consider equal His servants who believe and do good deeds with those who deny His oneness and follow their desires.

The believers referred to in this verse are those who believe that Allah is One, not needing partners in carrying out His power and will. Based on that belief, they realize and carry out what should be done towards their fellow human beings and towards their Creator. With that belief, they obey the commands of their Creator conveyed through His Messenger and avoid all His prohibitions. They always strive to keep their souls clean from the stains that defile them.

Allah says:

"And far removed from it (Hell) will be the righteous, who gives of his wealth to purify himself, and does not confer a favor upon anyone for a reward." (al-Lail/92: 17-19)

While those who commit corruption on earth are those who do not want to follow the truth and always follow their desires. They do not want to acknowledge the oneness of Allah, the truth of revelation, and the occurrence of the Day of Resurrection and Recompense. Therefore, they are far from the mercy of Allah and dare to violate His prohibitions. They do not believe that they will be resurrected from their graves; they will still be gathered in the Plain of Gathering (Padang Mahsyar) to account for their deeds.

Allah says:

"And We have fastened every man's deeds to his neck, and on the Day of Resurrection, We shall bring out for him a book which he will find wide open. 'Read your book! Sufficient is yourself this day as a reckoner against you.'" (al-Isra'/17: 13-14)

If some of Allah's servants are rewarded for their good deeds in the world and punished for their bad deeds, it is in accordance with Allah's wisdom. He has given them reason so that they can know how vast Allah's blessings are that have been given to them. However, they do not want to use that reason in the best way, so they do not give thanks for that blessing; they even deny it. Allah has also sent His Messenger to guide them to the right path. The guidance and direction of the Messenger are not only ignored by them, but they are even denied.
text.29:
Allah explains that He has revealed the Al-Qur'an to the Messenger of Allah (saw) and his followers. The Al-Qur'an is a perfect book containing guidance that is very beneficial to mankind. This guidance leads people to live prosperously in this world and happily in the hereafter. By contemplating its contents, humans will find ways to manage the benefits of life in this world. Parables and stories from previous peoples become lessons in pursuing their life goals and avoiding obstacles and barriers that hinder the achievement of life goals. The Al-Qur'an was revealed with the intention that its contents be contemplated, then understood with correct understanding, and then practiced as it should be. Correct understanding is obtained by following the instructions of the Messenger, assisted by the knowledge possessed, both related to language and social development. Likewise, in exploring the instructions contained in the book, it should be based on the guidance of the Messenger and strive to enliven the experience with knowledge from their experiences and thoughts.

Al-hasan al-Bashri explained the meaning of this verse by saying, "Many servants of Allah and children do not understand the meaning of the Al-Qur'an, even though they have memorized it by heart. They memorize it so well that not a single letter is left out. However, they ignore the provisions of the Al-Qur'an to the point that one of them says, "By Allah, I have read the Al-Qur'an, so that I have not missed a single letter." Actually, such a person has missed the entire Al-Qur'an, because the influence of the Al-Qur'an is not visible in him, either in his character or in his actions. By Allah, what is the use of memorizing every letter, as long as they ignore the provisions of Allah. They are not people of wisdom and people of teaching. May Allah not increase the number of people like that."

Ibnu Mas'ud said: People among us, when they learned ten verses of the Al-Qur'an, they did not move to other verses, until they understood the content of those ten verses and practiced its contents. (Narrated by A.hmad)
text.30:
Allah explains that in addition to David being bestowed with glory and power, he was also granted a righteous son, who had the ability to continue his struggle, namely Solomon. He inherited the characteristics of his father. He was known as a servant who was obedient in worship and in all matters he was always grateful to Allah. He was certain that all kinds of pleasures and beauty were realized solely because of the abundance of Allah's mercy and grace. That is why he was called the best servant of Allah, and as a praise that was worthy to be given to him. Allah describes him as His servant who is very obedient to Him. Thus, Allah raised Prophet Solomon to be a prophet succeeding the prophethood and kingdom of Prophet David, and inheriting his knowledge as contained in the Book of Psalms (Zabur).

Allah says:

And Solomon inherited David. (an-Naml/27: 16)
text.31: Allah mentions one of the events faced by Sulaiman, which caused him to deserve praise. This event occurred when he was inspecting the cavalry, which was usually done in the afternoon. The horses were trained so that their agility and movement capabilities could be known, making it possible to bring them to the battlefield. They were also trained in their ability to reduce their speed or stop suddenly, and their endurance was increased to face sudden attacks. The horses were trained in such a way that they could be controlled according to the tactics desired by the troops riding them. The agility of the horse contributed to the success or failure of the troops in controlling the battlefield and breaking enemy attacks.
text.32:
Then Allah explains Solomon's state when witnessing the horse training. He said that he loved horses because they were very useful for being used as a means of upholding the truth and defending the religion of Allah. His pleasure in training horses was so deep that every afternoon he visited the horse training ground until the sun set on the western horizon, that is, until the sunlight began to fade, and the darkness of night prevented him from witnessing the training. At those moments, a conflict arose within him: which interest should be prioritized between the two interests? The first interest was his soul's awareness to worship Allah. While the second interest was training horses for the sake of upholding the truth and defending the word of *tauhid*. In such a situation, he realized that if he watched the horse training until late at night, it meant he was neglecting the worship he should be performing.

This verse does not explain in detail whether Solomon's pleasure in inspecting the horse training caused him to lose time for worship or not. Likewise, it is not explained which Solomon prioritized, inspecting horse training or performing worship. However, what can be understood from the verse is that while he was absorbed in watching the horse training, an awareness of worshiping Allah flashed in his heart; if his absorption was indulged, it would inevitably drag on until he lost the opportunity to commune with Allah. So, the understanding that should be taken from this verse is that the turmoil that occurred within Solomon was regret for not performing worship to Allah at its earliest time, because he was busy watching horse training. Then he realized and performed it at the end of its time.
text.33:
In this verse, Allah explains what Solomon commanded his horse trainers. He ordered his trainers to bring the horses back to him. After the trainer brought the horses to him, he approached them. Then he stroked the legs and necks of the horses as a sign of Solomon's satisfaction with the brilliant results achieved by the horses. Thus, the horses could be used in warfare to crush the enemy or to evade sudden enemy attacks.

From the above description, it can be said that Solomon was a pious servant of Allah, obedient in worship, meticulous, and careful in planning the struggle to uphold the word of Tawhid, and had a high awareness in decisive moments of what was more important than what was important.
text.34:
Then Allah explains the state of Solomon when he received the trial and his condition after facing that trial. Allah tested him by inflicting a severe illness upon him. So severe was the attack of the disease that he lost all strength. His body lay weak and limp on his throne as if lifeless.

Abu Hurairah narrated that the Prophet saw said:

Prophet Solomon said, "Tonight I will go around to ninety wives, all of whom will give birth to children who are skilled in riding horses and fighting *fi sabilillah*." Then a companion said to him, "Say *insha Allah*," but Prophet Solomon did not say *insha Allah*. Prophet Solomon then went around to all his wives, but none of them became pregnant except one wife, who then gave birth to an imperfect child. By the One in whose Hand is the soul of Muhammad, "If Prophet Solomon had said *insha Allah*, all his wives would have given birth to children who were skilled in riding horses and fighting *fi sabilillah*." (Narrated by al-Bukhari and Muslim from Abu Hurairah)

Another explanation clarifies that the trial referred to concerns Prophet Solomon's desire to visit ninety of his wives in one night and for each of his wives to give birth to a horseman. However, he did not say *insha Allah*, so Allah tested him with the trial that none gave birth except only one person, who gave birth to a baby paralyzed on one side of its body and placed on Prophet Solomon's throne.

In those moments of receiving such trials, he always raised his hopes to Allah and surrendered himself to accept the trial sincerely. At the end of the verse, Allah affirms that Solomon then repented, asking forgiveness for the weaknesses that were in him, and surrendered himself to Allah.
text.35:
Allah then explained that after Solomon recovered from his illness, he realized the weaknesses within himself. He had chosen something less important. He had lost the prime time for worship because he was watching the horse training.

Then Prophet Solomon prayed to Allah to be granted a kingdom that was unparalleled, that no one after him would possess. In a hadith of the Prophet Muhammad (saw) it is narrated:

That the Prophet (saw) said: That an Ifrit from the jinn spat on me last night so that I would cancel my prayer, but Allah gave me strength so that I could catch the jinn. I intended to tie him to one of the pillars of the mosque so that you could see him. But I remembered the prayer of my brother Solomon, "O Allah, forgive me, and grant me strength that is not worthy to be given to anyone after me." So I drove him away. (Narrated by al-Bukhari and Muslim)

Prophet Solomon was raised in a royal and prophetic environment. From a young age, he was trained as a child of a king and a prophet. Solomon inherited both abilities, and Allah also bestowed upon him that ability. That is why Allah granted him a very strong kingdom and abundant wealth, which was unparalleled.

At the end of the verse, Allah mentions the reason Solomon put forward in his prayer, namely because Allah will truly grant the prayer of everyone who is accompanied by effort and the conditions of ability possessed according to His will.
text.36:
In this verse, Allah explains some of the blessings bestowed upon Prophet Sulaiman (Solomon), as an answer to his prayer. First: Allah granted Sulaiman the power to subdue the wind. With Allah's permission, the wind blew strongly or gently according to his will.

Allah says:

"And to Solomon (We subjected) the wind, blowing forcefully, proceeding by his command toward the land which We had blessed. And We are ever, of all things, Knowing." (al-Anbiya'/21: 81)

Second: Allah granted him the ability to subdue devils who were skilled in construction and diving, performing tasks according to Sulaiman's commands. If he ordered them to build a structure such as palace meeting halls, defensive fortresses, or buildings to store Sulaiman's wealth and other things, they could complete the task in a very short time. If Sulaiman ordered them to collect pearls and coral, as well as other marine treasures, that task could also be completed quickly.

Third: Allah granted him the power to subdue devils who defied his commands. Their hands and feet were bound in shackles, so that they would not be dangerous to others, and as punishment for their disobedience.

The power that Allah gave Sulaiman to subdue the devils meant the power to move them to perform heavy tasks, namely the task of building buildings and diving to extract marine wealth. However, there is no definite information about how Sulaiman shackled the devils. The most important attitude is that we accept the information contained in the Qur'an and to reveal its meaning, we surrender it to science.
